text.div:
Generated Narrative: CapabilityStatement oncofair-health-data-warehouse

OncoFAIR Health Data Warehouse

  • Implementation Guide Version: 0.1.0
  • FHIR Version: 5.0.0
  • Supported Formats: xml, json
  • Supported Patch Formats:
  • Published on: 2024-06-19 15:15:00+0100
  • Published by: DOMASIA team of the Signal and Image Processing Laboratory (LTSI) and KEREVAL

Note to Implementers: FHIR Capabilities

Any FHIR capability may be 'allowed' by the system unless explicitly marked as 'SHALL NOT'. A few items are marked as MAY in the Implementation Guide to highlight their potential relevance to the use case.

FHIR RESTful Capabilities

REST Configuration: 1

Mode: server

A database intended to be used for research, studies or evaluation in the field of health.

Security
Enable CORS: no
Security services supported: OAuth
Summary of System-wide Interactions

Capabilities by Resource/Profile

Summary

The summary table lists the resources that are part of this configuration, and for each resource it lists:

  • The relevant profiles (if any)
  • The interactions supported by each resource (Read, Search, Update, and Create, are always shown, while VRead, Patch, Delete, History on Instance, or History on Type are only present if at least one of the resources has support for them.
  • The required, recommended, and some optional search parameters (if any).
  • The linked resources enabled for _include
  • The other resources enabled for _revinclude
  • The operations on the resource (if any)
Resource TypeProfileRSUCSearches_include_revincludeOperations
Patienthttp://ltsi.univ-rennes.fr/StructureDefinition/oncofair-patientyyyidentifier
Encounterhttp://ltsi.univ-rennes.fr/StructureDefinition/oncofair-encounteryyyidentifier
Observationhttp://ltsi.univ-rennes.fr/StructureDefinition/oncofair-observationyyclinical-code, clinical-date
Medicationhttp://ltsi.univ-rennes.fr/StructureDefinition/oncofair-medicationyyy_filter, _has, _id, clinical-code, medication-type
MedicationRequesthttp://ltsi.univ-rennes.fr/StructureDefinition/oncofair-medicationrequest-prescription
Additional supported profiles:
  OncoFAIR MedicationRequest Component		yyyidentifier, wording, indication, mr-prescription-validation-date, mr-type-elementprescription, element-form, status, element-route, element-site, combo-date, mr-date-time-prescription-start, mr-date-time-prescription-end, mr-element-gonogo-status, mr-element-gonogo-reasonwaiting, group-identifier, mr-element-frequency-posology, mr-element-duration-posology, mr-element-rate-posology, mr-element-quantity-posology, mr-prescribed-component-quantity, mr-component-substitution, mr-is-dosage-referent, mr-exempt-ltc, mr-component-solute
CarePlanhttp://ltsi.univ-rennes.fr/StructureDefinition/oncofair-careplanyyyidentifier, cp-title, status, cp-date-time-reference, indication
MedicationAdministrationhttp://ltsi.univ-rennes.fr/StructureDefinition/oncofair-medicationadministration-element
Additional supported profiles:
  OncoFAIR MedicationAdministration Report		yyyma-method, ma-category, element-form, element-route, element-site, date, ma-comments, ma-planned-quantity, ma-prescribed-quantity, identifier, wording, performer

Resource Conformance: supported Medication
Base System Profile
http://ltsi.univ-rennes.fr/StructureDefinition/oncofair-medication
Profile Conformance
SHALL
Reference Policy

Interaction summary
  • Supports search-type, read, create.

Search Parameters
ConformanceParameterTypeDocumentation
SHALL_filterspecial

Filter search parameter that supports a more sophisticated search grammar. See documentation for more details.

SHALL_hasspecial

Enables resources to be selected on the basis of the properties of the resources that refer to them (reverse chaining).

SHALL_idtoken

Logical resource identifier

SHALLclinical-codetoken

Identifies the prescribed component according to a nomenclature depending on the type

SHALLmedication-typetoken

Specifies whether the component prescribed is a speciality, a common name or any other product (pharmacopoeia).

 
Resource Conformance: supported MedicationRequest
Base System Profile
http://ltsi.univ-rennes.fr/StructureDefinition/oncofair-medicationrequest-prescription
Profile Conformance
SHALL
Reference Policy

Supported Profiles

http://ltsi.univ-rennes.fr/StructureDefinition/oncofair-medicationrequest-component

Interaction summary
  • Supports search-type, read, create.

Search Parameters
ConformanceParameterTypeDocumentation
SHALLidentifiertoken

Identifier

SHALLwordingstring

Wording of element/component

SHALLindicationstring

Indications concerning the prescription item and the component prescribed

SHALLmr-prescription-validation-datedate

Date and time at which the prescriber considered the prescription validated

SHALLmr-type-elementprescriptiontoken

Type of prescription element

SHALLelement-formtoken

Pharmaceutical form of the prescription item

SHALLstatustoken

Indicates the status of the protocol from the prescriber's point of view

SHALLelement-routetoken

Specifies the route of administration of the product

SHALLelement-sitetoken

Specifies, where appropriate, the exact point on the body where the product is to be applied to the patient

SHALLcombo-datedate

Returns medication request to be administered on a specific date or within a date range

SHALLmr-date-time-prescription-startdate

Effective start date and time of product prescription

SHALLmr-date-time-prescription-enddate

Effective end date and time of product prescription

SHALLmr-element-gonogo-statustoken

Communicates the conditional state of implementation of the prescription element according to a list of coded values

SHALLmr-element-gonogo-reasonwaitingtoken

Describes the reason for the goNogo implementation status of the prescription element if the management option via the goNogo attribute is enabled

SHALLgroup-identifiertoken

Identifier common to all components of the same prescription

SHALLmr-element-frequency-posologynumber

Indicates the recurrence of the dosage. By default, every day

SHALLmr-element-duration-posologynumber

Duration of administration

SHALLmr-element-rate-posologyquantity

Rate of administration in the case of injection

SHALLmr-element-quantity-posologyquantity

Quantity of the prescription element in the dosage

SHALLmr-prescribed-component-quantityquantity

Quantity of the component prescribed in the prescription element

SHALLmr-component-substitutiontoken

True if the component prescribed is declared non-substitutable in the prescription element

SHALLmr-is-dosage-referenttoken

True if the component prescribed is the component that refers to the quantity or flow rate expressed in the dosage element when these are gravimetric (for example, mg or mg/h).

SHALLmr-exempt-ltctoken

Identifier of the ALD for which the component prescribed is prescribed for one of the reasons for which the patient benefits from an exemption under article L324-1 of the CSS.

SHALLmr-component-solutetoken

True if the component prescribed is solute in the prescription element

 
Resource Conformance: supported CarePlan
Base System Profile
http://ltsi.univ-rennes.fr/StructureDefinition/oncofair-careplan
Profile Conformance
SHALL
Reference Policy

Interaction summary
  • Supports search-type, read, create.

Search Parameters
ConformanceParameterTypeDocumentation
SHALLidentifiertoken

Prescribed protocol identifier

SHALLcp-titlestring

Wording of the prescribed protocol

SHALLstatustoken

Indicates the status of the protocol from the prescriber's point of view

SHALLcp-date-time-referencedate

Reference date and time of this prescribed protocol

SHALLindicationstring

Indication concerning the prescribed protocol

 
Resource Conformance: supported MedicationAdministration
Base System Profile
http://ltsi.univ-rennes.fr/StructureDefinition/oncofair-medicationadministration-element
Profile Conformance
SHALL
Reference Policy

Supported Profiles

http://ltsi.univ-rennes.fr/StructureDefinition/oncofair-medicationadministration-report

Interaction summary
  • Supports search-type, read, create.

Search Parameters
ConformanceParameterTypeDocumentation
SHALLma-methodtoken

Type of administration element

SHALLma-categorytoken

Code identifying the nature of the administration element

SHALLelement-formtoken

Pharmaceutical form of the administration item

SHALLelement-routetoken

Specifies the route of administration of the product

SHALLelement-sitetoken

Specifies, where applicable, the exact point on the body where the product is to be applied to the patient. By default, the place of administration is that shown in the prescription element associated with the administration element

SHALLdatedate

Effective date and time for starting/ending administration of the administration element

SHALLma-commentsstring

Comments of component

SHALLma-planned-quantityquantity

Quantity of the component administered in the administration element that was intended to be administered to the patient

SHALLma-prescribed-quantityquantity

Quantity actually administered to the patient or planned to be administered

SHALLidentifiertoken

Identifier

SHALLwordingstring

Wording of component/element of administration

SHALLperformerreference

Identification of the person who planned, administered or monitored the administration of the medicines represented by the administration elements

 

REST Configuration: 2

Mode: client

Search for aggregated data on chemotherapy to feed the warehouse

Security
Enable CORS: no
Security services supported: OAuth

searchParam.documentation: Identifier of the ALD for which the component prescribed is prescribed for one of the reasons for which the patient benefits from an exemption under article L324-1 of the CSS.

searchParam.name: mr-component-solute
searchParam.documentation: True if the component prescribed is solute in the prescription element

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Prescribed protocol identifier

searchParam.name: cp-title
searchParam.documentation: Wording of the prescribed protocol

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: Indicates the status of the protocol from the prescriber's point of view

searchParam.name: cp-date-time-reference
searchParam.documentation: Reference date and time of this prescribed protocol

searchParam.name: indication
searchParam.documentation: Indication concerning the prescribed protocol

searchParam.name: ma-method
searchParam.documentation: Type of administration element

searchParam.name: ma-category
searchParam.documentation: Code identifying the nature of the administration element

searchParam.name: element-form
searchParam.documentation: Pharmaceutical form of the administration item

searchParam.name: element-route
searchParam.documentation: Specifies the route of administration of the product

searchParam.name: element-site
searchParam.documentation: Specifies, where applicable, the exact point on the body where the product is to be applied to the patient. By default, the place of administration is that shown in the prescription element associated with the administration element

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Effective date and time for starting/ending administration of the administration element

searchParam.name: ma-comments
searchParam.documentation: Comments of component

searchParam.name: ma-planned-quantity
searchParam.documentation: Quantity of the component administered in the administration element that was intended to be administered to the patient

searchParam.name: ma-prescribed-quantity
searchParam.documentation: Quantity actually administered to the patient or planned to be administered

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Identifier

searchParam.name: wording
searchParam.documentation: Wording of component/element of administration

searchParam.name: performer
searchParam.documentation: Identification of the person who planned, administered or monitored the administration of the medicines represented by the administration elements

searchParam.name: clinical-code
searchParam.documentation: Nature of additional information representing by LOINC code

searchParam.name: clinical-date
searchParam.documentation: Date and time of registration of the additional information
